MuscleLib API

Welcome to the MuscleLib API documentation. Explore our endpoints and access a comprehensive database of exercises to enhance your fitness applications.

API Documentation Report Issues

800+ Exercises

1000+ Images

What Makes MuscleLib Different

Developer First

Simple and intuitive API, easy to integrate with any language or platform.

RESTful API

Well-structured and predictable endpoints to simplify data consumption.

High Performance

Fast and efficient responses, ensuring minimal latency.

Extensive Exercise Database

Comprehensive exercise library with illustrative images stored in a CDN for quick loading.

Muscle Targeting

Each exercise includes detailed information about the primary and secondary muscles worked.

No API Key Required

Direct access to the API without authentication, making integration hassle-free.

Multilingual Support

Support for multiple languages, ensuring global accessibility.

Open Source

MuscleLib API is open-source. Check out the source code on github.

Free

Free access for testing, no payment required.

Terms of Service Privacy Policy
Terms of Service

MuscleLib API – Terms of Service

1. Acceptance of Terms

By accessing or using the MuscleLib API, you agree to these Terms of Service.
If you do not agree with any part of these terms, you must not use the API.

2. Use of the API

The MuscleLib API is provided free of charge and is currently intended for small to medium-sized projects.
Because the API is still under development, temporary outages, changes, or instability may occur.

3. Intellectual Property

The exercise data and images provided by the MuscleLib API are considered public domain or free-to-use sources.
However, the API source code, documentation structure, and related software are the intellectual property of the MuscleLib project.

You may not copy, redistribute, or resell the API itself without explicit permission.

4. Limitation of Liability

The API is provided “as is”, without warranties of any kind.
The MuscleLib project is not responsible for any direct, indirect, incidental, or consequential damages resulting from the use or inability to use the API.

5. Changes to the Terms

These Terms of Service may be updated at any time.
Continued use of the API after changes are published constitutes acceptance of the revised terms.

Privacy Policy

MuscleLib API – Privacy Policy

1. Data Collection

The MuscleLib API does not collect, store, or process personal user data.

2. Cookies

Cookies are used only to store:

  • Language preference
  • Theme preference (light / dark / auto)

No tracking, analytics, or advertising cookies are used.

3. Data Sharing

No data is shared with third parties.
All stored preferences are used exclusively to improve the user experience.

4. Changes to This Policy

This Privacy Policy may be updated periodically.
Any changes will be reflected in this documentation.
